page.title: 01WHERE IS NORTH SCARLE?
page.content: Our village of North Scarle lies in the West part ofthe county of Lincoln Shire.We are very close to the border between Lincoln Shire and Nottingham Shire.Lincoln is our county town and is our nearest city.North Scarle is midway between the towns of Gains borough in the North and Newark in the South.In North Scarle we are surrounded by deep dykes which drain the fields.Our nearest river is the River Trent.The River Witham lies to the South.Eleven miles North of Scarle is the Fosse Dyke which was dug by the Romans to join these two rivers.There are many ponds and pools around our village.They are now used for fishing and sailing but they were dug to get sand and gravel out of the ground.
